name: American Revolution
description: The American Revolutionary War (1775-1783) was a conflict in which the Thirteen Colonies gained independence from Great Britain, forming the United States of America.
metaDescription: Experience the American Revolution as if social media existed. Follow the Founding Fathers, British officials, and ordinary colonists through this pivotal moment in history.

name: Ancient Rome
description: The Roman Republic and Empire, from Caesar to Marcus Aurelius. Emperors, senators, gladiators, and citizens posting through conquest, betrayal, and philosophy.
metaDescription: Experience Ancient Rome through the eyes of emperors like Caesar and Marcus Aurelius, senators like Cicero, gladiators like Spartacus, and ordinary citizens.

name: World War II
description: The global conflict from 1939 to 1945 through soldiers, leaders, resistance fighters, and civilians on all fronts.
metaDescription: Experience World War II through soldiers, leaders, and civilians. From D-Day to Stalingrad, from the home front to the Holocaust.

name: Renaissance & Enlightenment
description: The rebirth of art, science, and human potential. From Leonardo to Newton, from Gutenberg to Galileo.
metaDescription: Experience the Renaissance and Enlightenment through artists, scientists, and thinkers who reshaped human understanding.

name: Civil Rights Movement
description: The struggle for equality in America from Montgomery to Memphis. Leaders, activists, and ordinary people fighting for justice.
metaDescription: Experience the Civil Rights Movement through the voices of MLK, Rosa Parks, and countless activists who changed America.

name: French Revolution
description: Liberty, Equality, Fraternity. From the storming of the Bastille to the rise of Napoleon. The Terror, the guillotine, and the birth of modern politics.
metaDescription: Experience the French Revolution through revolutionaries, royalty, and ordinary citizens. From the Bastille to the guillotine to Napoleon.

name: Ancient Greece
description: The birthplace of democracy, philosophy, and Western civilization. From the Persian Wars to Alexander the Great, from Socrates to Aristotle.
metaDescription: Experience Ancient Greece through philosophers like Socrates and Plato, warriors like Leonidas and Alexander, and the citizens who invented democracy.

name: World War I
description: The Great War that shattered empires and a generation. From the trenches of the Western Front to Gallipoli, from war poets to shell shock.
metaDescription: Experience the Great War through soldiers in the trenches, war poets, nurses, generals, and civilians caught in the first modern industrial war.

name: Industrial Revolution
description: The transformation that changed humanity forever. Steam engines, factories, railroads, child labor, and the birth of the modern world. From cottage industry to smokestacks.
metaDescription: Experience the Industrial Revolution through inventors, factory workers, reformers, and ordinary people whose world transformed before their eyes.

name: Viking Age
description: Norse raiders, explorers, and settlers who shaped medieval Europe. From the raid on Lindisfarne to the discovery of Vinland, from pagan warriors to Christian kings.
metaDescription: Experience the Viking Age through raiders, explorers, kings, and settlers. From Lindisfarne to Vinland, from Ragnar Lothbrok to the Norman Conquest.

name: Medieval Period & Crusades
description: Holy wars, feudal lords, and the clash of civilizations. Knights Templar, Saladin, Richard the Lionheart, and the ordinary people caught between empires and faiths.
metaDescription: Experience the Crusades through knights, sultans, monks, and merchants. Holy wars, sieges, and the meeting of East and West.

name: Ancient Egypt
description: The land of pharaohs, pyramids, and the Nile. Three thousand years of civilization from the Great Pyramid to Cleopatra's last breath.
metaDescription: Experience Ancient Egypt through pharaohs like Ramesses and Cleopatra, priests, scribes, and the workers who built the pyramids.

name: American Civil War
description: Brother against brother. The war that ended slavery and nearly destroyed the Union. From Fort Sumter to Appomattox, told by those who lived it.
metaDescription: Experience the Civil War through Lincoln, Lee, Grant, Frederick Douglass, and the soldiers, nurses, and enslaved people who lived through America's bloodiest conflict.

name: Cold War & Space Race
description: Superpowers, spies, and the race to the stars. From the Iron Curtain to the Moon landing, the world held its breath.
metaDescription: Experience the Cold War through presidents, cosmonauts, spies, and ordinary citizens living under the nuclear shadow.

name: Age of Exploration
description: When sailors reached the ends of the earth. Columbus, Magellan, Zheng He, and the indigenous peoples whose worlds collided with Europe's ambitions.
metaDescription: Experience the Age of Exploration through sailors, conquistadors, and indigenous peoples. The voyages that connected the world and changed it forever.

name: Byzantine Empire
description: The Eastern Roman Empire that preserved classical knowledge for a thousand years. From Constantine to the fall of Constantinople, emperors, scholars, and saints shaped civilization.
metaDescription: Experience the Byzantine Empire through emperors like Justinian and Constantine XI, scholars who preserved ancient knowledge, and the fall of Constantinople.

name: Mongol Empire
description: The largest contiguous land empire in history. From Genghis Khan to Kublai Khan, warriors, merchants, and diplomats connected East and West along the Silk Road.
metaDescription: Experience the Mongol Empire through Genghis Khan, Kublai Khan, Marco Polo, and the warriors and traders who built the largest land empire in history.
